publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: A new postil : conteinyng most godly and learned sermons vpon all the Sonday Gospelles, that be redde in the church thorowout the yeare
monogr.author: Becon, Thomas

q.p: O Howe beautiful are the feete of them, which bryng the gladde tydynges of peace, and shewe the good and ioyefull newes of our saluation.

LIke as the rayne and snowe commeth downe from heauen, and returneth not thither agayn, but watereth the earth, maketh it fruitful and grene, that it may geue corne to the sower, and bread to the eater: so the worde also that commeth out of my mouthe, shall not turne agayn voyde vnto me, but shall accomplishe my wille, and prosper in them, vnto whome I sende it.
WHat hath chaffe and wheate to doo together, sayth the Lord? Is not my worde, like a fyre, sayth the Lord? And like an hammer, that breaketh the harde stone?
HE sent his worde, and healed them: and they were saued from theyr destruction.
IT is neyther herbe nor playster, that restored them to health, but thy word (O Lord) which healeth all things.
NOw are ye cleane thorowe the worde, that I haue spoken vnto you.
I Am not ashamed of the gospel of Christe, because it is the power of God vnto saluation to euery one that beleueth.

THe woorde of God is quicke and myghtie in operation and sharper then any two edged sword: and entreth thorough euen vnto the deuidyng asunder of the soule and the spirite, and of the ioyntes and the marye.
